intro: Saussurea microdeltoidea, commonly known as the narrow-leafed yarrow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and fibrous root system. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a hairy surface, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Saussurea microdeltoidea is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies for its anti-inflammatory and analgesic effects.
